[b][color=white]Suggestions and Ideas Forum Closed[/color][/b]
The Suggestions and Ideas forum that is located in the RANF forum was recently closed on August 6, 2017.  [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has no intentions on deleting the forum itself so you'll still have access to reminisce and view old threads, but he states that it possibly will be re-opened in the future. [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] would like to focus more on features that are already part of Hack Forums, rather than those that most likely have been already suggested as he stated in his thread.  [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5688168]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
 
[b][color=white]Sports World Moved[/color][/b]
In addition to the [url=https://hackforums.net/forumdisplay.php?fid=373]Writer Tales[/url] sub-forum that was moved to the [url=https://hackforums.net/forumdisplay.php?fid=259]Personal Life[/url] category,  [url=https://hackforums.net/forumdisplay.php?fid=167]Sports World[/url] finds a new home. The forum was originally in [url=https://hackforums.net/forumdisplay.php?fid=25]The Lounge[/url] prior to it being moved. The Personal Life forum now has 10 sub-forums under the category.
 
[color=transparent]       [/color]

[hr]
 
[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/ihtMQ1m.png[/img]
[color=1E90FF][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1678360]Faith Connors[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]
 
[hr]
 
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#99FFAA][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: Welcome to the 355th edition of the Hack Forums News. We're here today with our first interviewee, Faith Connors. Would you like to give any shoutouts before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1678360][color=#ffffff][b]Faith Connors[/b][/color][/url]: Uhhhhh how about Victory, TheChief, and some guy who got closed a while ago, The3PonyWizard. If only he was still around :think_react: Also Levi for being a great friend and having good music taste<3 loveya<3 ;*
 
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#99FFAA][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: You're currently away in Japan. You created a thread in the lounge and it has received a fair amount of replies. Are you enjoying your time there?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1678360][color=#ffffff][b]Faith Connors[/b][/color][/url]: A few things to note: Half the replies are mine. Ive also only been here a few days excluding my two week trip last year. Otherwise yes. I just woke up in my capsule hotel (Ginza Bay Hotel, they have an all women floor lol) and i gotta say it was really comfy. There is a Lawsons convenience store around the corner if I want food or drink but there's also a vending machine in here. Food is good, people are nice, and if youre irl quiet and have mastered non verbal communication, you can get around just fine.
 
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#99FFAA][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: That sounds like fun for an introvert such as myself. I noticed that a majority of your posts are in the Beginner Hacking forum, where you've assisted many people, as well as created help desks there. Despite being Hack Forums, there are actually not a lot of people who come here for the hacking. What got you so interested in that specific forum?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1678360][color=#ffffff][b]Faith Connors[/b][/color][/url]: It may not be what most people are here for, but it is in the name and there is a section for it. I have some knowledge on hacking so I may as well help people out with getting started. It pains me to see people give up or suddenly lose interest when they discover hacking their boyfriend or wife or whatever is a multistep process or downright impossible so they just give up and leave. But it is what it is. The people who do stick around do get better, i have helped people who got much better later on, and have met some otherwise very knowledgeable people on here as well, as scarce as they are.
 
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#99FFAA][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: During your "HF Career" as I like to call it, has anyone sent you a private message after you've helped? For example, let's say you helped a member get better at something they were struggling with. Have you ever received a PM thanking you for what you've taught them or at least updating you with what they have learned?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1678360][color=#ffffff][b]Faith Connors[/b][/color][/url]: Well people PM me all the time asking for assistance or an explanation. Ive also hosted an IRC server for a more group oriented approach or just somewhere people could just ask a question and instantly get a reply.  And most times i have gotten a thank you, yes. The only times i havent would be when someone reached out to me to straight up make them something, either a program, a script or even phishing pages, and I straight up told them to fuck off and stop being skids. It doesnt happen often but it does happen.
 
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#99FFAA][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: A lot of people expect free things when they join this site. I was definitely like that, but over time understood I had to work for it if I wanted something. Groups have come and gone throughout the years. Being a 2013 member, you've seen your fair share of groups. Is there any group in particular that you miss from the past?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1678360][color=#ffffff][b]Faith Connors[/b][/color][/url]: Well, I am a fan of literature, and I guess the Black Lodge would be the best for that, with all their sections for SRPP and reading and stuff. I personally wasnt in it because of the steep buyin of 125$ but it looked really cool anyway. I also miss Enigmav1, with the orange and blue userbar. That was one of my favourite bars. I was actually in the group for about two weeks and I gotta say, it was actually really active. Not sure why I was kicked, but whatever. Finally I miss Riptude. Artsy, friendly, and sadly inactive :( I was the only person that posted in the music section anymore. I hope that Harmony does a better job keeping people active. With illuminati as the leader it should be fine as i believe he was a leader in Riptide as well.
 
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#99FFAA][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: The group scene has changed so much in the past few years it's crazy. What would you say is the biggest lesson you've learned while browsing this forum?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1678360][color=#ffffff][b]Faith Connors[/b][/color][/url]: That I can yell at people with almost no repercussions because you guys all love me <3 Uhh in all seriousness I'm really not sure. I wanna try and be inspirational. Maybe something like "theres always someone better than you." I would talk to th3ponywizard offsite and hes really smart, a nice guy (even if he doesnt seem like it) and super knowledgeable, but when i call him a hacker he dismisses it. Hes very humble in that sense. Many people who are admittedly miles above me feel the same way. I guess that would be my inspirational post for the day.
 
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#99FFAA][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: I remember Pony. We never really talked, but I know that he was a leader of some sort of group. Forgot whether it was a cyber security or hacking group. I keep saying over the years repetitively, but it's very true. So I'll say it once more, over the years the attitudes of members have changed a lot. What do you think HF will be like in future? Same as it is now or do you think it will evolve immensely?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1678360][color=#ffffff][b]Faith Connors[/b][/color][/url]: I think the whole idea of hacking will go down the drain for HF. The marketplace is getting too big and this site is now almost exclusively a place for people to troll, scam, and sell their shitty products. If omni wanted to keep the hacking niche as the predominant subject, he would either close off the marketplace or limit it (ie. No ebooks, only x threads per user per section, all deals must be on site) but yhe fact he doesnt proves a multitude of things, or a conbination of them if not all:
 
1. The marketplace is too big and attracts most of the users to this site
2. If it closes, most people dont know what to do with their lives and will just leave.
3. Imposing the limits will also make people leave or find workarounds anyway (ie. Thread with link to rocketr store which has all products rather that a thread per product)
4. Most of the people in the marketplace have no hacking background whatsoever.
 
This forum will straight up become a forum for marketting only. A place for people to advertise. I dont want to see that happen, but we're getting there, at an alarmingly fast rate. May as well rebrand the site to craigsforum. And when that happens, you can be sure I'll be long gone, either at a competitor forum or I'll start my own. Without a marketplace (or a very specific limited market.
 
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#99FFAA][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: Many people lose faith in this website or just lose interest in general. It's good to see that HF is still in your heart. :) The description of HF includes that Hack Forums is a technology and security social media forum. Are there any other sub forums you think should be removed too because they aren't true to the "root of HF".
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1678360][color=#ffffff][b]Faith Connors[/b][/color][/url]: For the most part no. The lounge would be my main questionable point, but again if it wasnt here most forum activity would drop considerably. Maybe that new Meme section. Hate it. But it keeps the trolls at bay, i hope. So i dont think it should be removed. At least not yet. Most of the sute is related to tech in one way or another. The ability to talk about stuff legally is cool, however I would like some parts freed up, like for phishing. Although it's usually sicussed as blackhat, it does have many practical uses, for instance cracking wifi. When someone kicks someone off a network to get the target to connect to a malicious AP, is that not in a sense phishing? I feel that rule should be reworked somehow. Phishing isn't always bad.
 
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#99FFAA][b]Tsundere[/b][/color][/url]: That is all the time we have today. Thank you so much for taking the time out of your day to do this with me. Would you like to say any final words or even give some more shoutouts to anyone you missed?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1678360][color=#ffffff][b]Faith Connors[/b][/color][/url]: Uhh not really lol Im gonna go get breakfast or something now, ciao!
 
[/align][/spoiler][/align]
 
[hr]
 
[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/H5MRIbN.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Researchers Make Skype Call With Battery-Free Cell Phone[/color][/b] 
On June 30, researchers at the University of Washington managed to make an audio Skype call on a battery-less cellular phone. How could this be possible, you ask? There were two main challenges associated with making the call, first and foremost would be the power consumption of the processor. The processor used in this prototype uses just a few microwatts which pale in comparison to the hundred microwatts that most mainstream cellular devices use. The other major problem these researchers had to solve was keeping the system continuously operating. This was attained by making the device analog, which is fairly atypical for the industry. Analog allowed the researchers to utilize an analog backscatter meaning that the device will consume even less power and allow it to be able to operate for periods of time using ambient light. The team claims that this project is still very early days but are hopeful that the reduced power consumption of 5G will bring it much closer to reality. [i][size=x-small][url=http://postris.com/article/44/researches-have-managed-to-build-a-fully-operational-battery/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Psychedelic Drug Helps Depressed Patients ‘Re-Connect’ to the World[/color][/b] 
According to a recently published study, one particular psychedelic could be playing a larger role in treating depression. Psilocybin, which is the main acting ingredient in what is known as "magic" mushrooms, is the particular psychedelic researchers have turned to. Psychedelics have shown in the past to enable people to fully disconnect from reality, this study expands upon that and focuses it towards depression. It also acknowledges that there are plenty of problems with the current lineup of pharmaceutical antidepressants. Although this study is still early, it is seeing almost universally positive results. One of the participants in the study has claimed “my previous treatments, talking therapy and meds, were next to useless, utterly useless. My experience of psilocybin has been very positive. I believe there is an unknown physiological and neurochemical change in me, I am absolutely convinced of that.” I'll certainly be keeping a close eye on this one, as should you. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.psypost.org/2017/08/study-psychedelic-drug-psilocybin-helps-depressed-patients-re-connect-world-49407]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Methane-Eating Bacteria Found Beneath Antarctic ice [/color][/b] 
Greenhouse gas consuming bacteria has been discovered underneath sheets of ice in the Antarctic. This bacteria, in particular, prefers to snack on methane. The samples this bacteria has been discovered in was first collected by deep drilling at Lake Williams back in 2013. More specifically this bacteria was discovered to be residing in the upper lake sediment, which suggests that they were helping prevent the well of methane underneath from reaching the supply of water just above. Scientists also believe there is a large methane reservoir under the Arctic sheets, which could eventually be released by increasing temperatures. Should this ever be released, it would greatly further along global warming. These bacteria may give us a shot just yet.  [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.newsweek.com/methane-eating-bacteria-antarctic-ice-645570]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]
[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/vBnTpNT.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]China Urging North Korea to Stop Missile Tests[/color][/b] 
This week, North Korea has been causing rather large disturbances after missile tests carried out in Pyongyang, including potential nuclear tests. China has now urged its neighbor to stop the tests just after sanctions were agreed upon by the United Nations Security Council. The sanctions are banning North Korean exports and are limiting any investments into the country. The vote was an outstanding 15-0 with both China and Russia voting for the sanction. These new sanctions could cut back North Koreans earnings by over $1bn, but China's participation will be looked at closely due to them being the largest import/export partnership with Northern Korea. Rodong Sinmun, a ruling party newspaper, has claimed that nuclear action or sanctions taken by Washington would lead to an "unimaginable sea of fire" engulfing the US. The constant missile and nuclear testing is a breach of UN resolutions and have been condemned by many with South Korea saying it may hold talks with its Northern counterparts to help lead the peace.  [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-40842068]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Eight are Dead After Church Attack[/color][/b] 
At least eight people have been killed in an attack in southern Nigeria. The attack happened at the church in Ozubulu near the city of Onitsha and although conflicting reports on a number of gunmen at the scene, whether it was a group or a lone gunman, all agree that up to 18 were injured in the attack and eight were killed. Police believe the shooting was carried out due to the result of an argument between Nigerians from Ozubulu who were living abroad. The attacker is believed to have been someone from the local community and during Sunday Mass, burst into the church targeting a lone person, but then began to open fire on the crowd. Eye-witness, Chukwuma Emeka, said that he had just stepped out the church "when I heard gunshots and screaming and people running inside. When the chaos subsided I went inside, I saw my fellow church members dead in a pool of their own blood and many others were screaming in pain." [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-40843878]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]    [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/Jvg81mQ.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Snapchat Got a Rival, And This Time It Is Google[/color][/b]
Google is creating innovation that would enable news distributors to build Snapchat-style stories that would live inside the organization's web crawler, as indicated by a report from The Wall Street Journal. The stories may take after what distributors have in the past made for Snapchat's Discover area, which blends mobile-first design with a mix of photographs, recordings, and content. Google is said to call the product "Stamp," with the "St" remaining for stories. There is the likelihood that it could live underneath the inquiry bar, where on Android clients are now served a rundown of suggested sites and news stories. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.theverge.com/2017/8/4/16098478/google-stamp-news-publishers-snapchat-discover-facebook-ads]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]New Apple Watch Will Have LTE[/color][/b]
Apple intends to release an Apple Watch with built-in LTE this year, as indicated by Bloomberg. The incorporation ought to permit Apple Watch proprietors to abandon their iPhone and still get near full functionality out of the watch. As of recently, the watch must be within the range of an iPhone to do most tasks, as to get notifications or make calls. 
There is still a great deal that is obscure here. Apple could offer models of the watch with and without LTE, as it does with the iPad, charging a premium for cellular service. This watch will probably require an additional data plan too. What is more, it will likely to be paired with an iPhone in some way or another, regardless of the possibility that the phone is not generally in a similar region. Battery life could be a noteworthy issue too on a gadget that scarcely keeps going an entire day as it seems to be. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.theverge.com/circuitbreaker/2017/8/4/16099746/apple-watch-lte-model-series-3]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]YouTube Android App to Get Speed Controls For Videos[/color][/b]
Google is dealing with to include speed controls for videos played on YouTube Android application. While the YouTube's desktop site as of now had this component, the YouTube app users on Android will likewise have the capacity to play videos quicker or slower soon. 
Like the desktop site, a user can back off the played video to 0.25x, 0.5x, or 0.75x its normal speed, or speedier the video to 1.25x, 1.5x, or 2x. "Changing the speed won't affect the labelled duration of the video you're watching, but it will decrease or increase the playback at the rate you've selected," says a 9To5Google report. [i][size=x-small][url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/technology/story/youtube-android-app-to-get-speed-controls-for-videos/1/1019456.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/GamingNews/Tsundere.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]PUBG Changes[/color][/b] 
With the implementation of car horns in PUBG, it is now a lot easier to piss off some of your favorite streamers. It was one thing to join a game and find out that you joined a session of someone who is streaming, then following them wherever they go. This could end up to instantly killing the player right off the bat, all the way to just screaming into your microphone like a child to mess with the streamers ears. Now, you have the option to drive around and honk for as much as you want. Bluehole has a policy that will ban you if you stream snipe someone. How much harder will the offense be now that there are horns? Team killers are already getting punished for ruining squads for people trying to enjoy the game. Will the bans be longer if you stream snipe? Some good news, however, is that PUBG recently hit 500,000 concurrent players. This lands the game in second place, where the first place game is Dota 2 with over 700,000 concurrent players. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.pcgamer.com/pubgs-new-car-horns-have-turned-stream-snipers-into-stream-honkers/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Pokemon Go Players in Europe Can Find Previously Region-Exclusive Pokemon This Weekend[/color][/b]
Pokemon Go and Niantic recently had a horrible experience with their last event in Chicago. Players from around the world flew to Chicago to participate in an event where you could catch rare Pokemon. However, this event turned out worse than expected. When you arrived at the event, there were many strict rules. Things like bringing food and drinks were disallowed. Imagine being in summer weather with nothing to eat or drink and you are sweating. Not a pleasant day. In addition to that mess, the servers were not even working during the event. So that means those who flew in all the way from Europe to play the game wasted their money on plane tickets for an event that was unsuccessful. A recent update from Niantic states that there will be rare Pokemon popping up all around Europe. Pokemon that are region locked like Mr. Mime (Japan) and Kangaskhan (Australia) will now be obtainable in Europe for a limited time (Until August 21). This is a great opportunity for those who do not want to travel to another country just to get a region locked Pokemon. By the time you are reading this you may have missed the chance to capture a Moltres. One of the three legendary bird Pokemon. Moltres can be captured in raid battles but only until August 7. Due to the long list of European cities where these rare Pokemon will be spotted, head over [url=https://pastebin.com/raw/GRxf9fTA]here[/url] to check out the list. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.gamespot.com/articles/pokemon-go-players-in-europe-can-find-previously-r/1100-6452285/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Call of Duty: Special Editions[/color][/b]
Even before the game is out, special editions for the upcoming Call of Duty game are being pushed out. Aside from the original copy of the game, you have the option to pre-order or purchase special editions that come with more content and memorabilia.  First, there is a PlayStation and Xbox One backpack bundle. Depending on which console you get, you will get different items in your bundle pack. If you were to purchase the PlayStation bundle, you would receive the game, of course, a season pass for all your DLC needs, zombies poster, and a World War 2 themed backpack. The PS4 version comes to about $170 USD. If you were to get the Xbox version, expect to get a lot more items, but for a higher price. Instead of $170 USD, you will pay around $300 USD for the Xbox version. In addition to the game, you will get the World War 2 style backpack too, but also a $50 USD Xbox Marketplace gift card, and a WWII deployment kit. What is in that kit? You are in for a treat! Inside is a WWII style flashlight, a canteen with a pouch to store it in, dog tags, a journal, poster, and a WWII encyclopedia. Now, that is not the only special edition so far. If you do not want to spend that much money you can get the Valor special edition. At the moment there is no price for it, so there is actually no information on whether or not it will be cheaper than the backpack bundle, but it may cost a few hundred bucks less. In the Valor special edition, you get the game in an awesome steel case. Next, you get a poster just like the other bundles. That is not all; you also get a bronze statue of soldiers hiding behind cover. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.destructoid.com/call-of-duty-wwii-special-valor-edition-including-gritty-bronze-statue-452950.phtml]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center]Gaming Video of the Week[sp]

[yt]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7W2PzM49cIA[/yt][/sp][/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/ctcHVCW.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]FBI Arrests Researcher Who Found 'Kill-Switch' to Stop WannaCry Ransomware[/color][/b] 
Imagine if you found the way to stop the WannaCry ransomware that has been plaguing computers all across the globe, only to be arrested soon after. A 22-year-old British man by the name of Marcus Hutchins was recently arrested by the FBI a little bit after he attended Def Con in Las Vegas. At the time of arrest, there was no public reason as to why he was arrested. By mistake, Hutchins added a domain to the virus that actually helped stop the spread of it globally. What is even funnier is that this was all done by mistake. The domain that he registered and assigned to the virus had stopped spreading the virus tremendously, and instead of infecting users, it would redirect the malware somewhere else. A little after the arrest, an update was made as to why Hutchins was arrested. Suspected of distributing a trojan back in 2014-2015 that is completely unrelated to the WannaCry, but instead to a virus that steals users bank information. [i][size=x-small][url=http://thehackernews.com/2017/08/marcus-hutchins-arrested-fbi.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]HBO Hacked — 'Game of Thrones' Scripts & Other Episodes Leaked Online[/color][/b] 
The popular American premium cable channel known as HBO was recently hacked. With that being said, scripts for the popular HBO show Game of Thrones, as well as other things were leaked to the internet. Over 1.5 terabytes of HBO information was hacked. All the way from unreleased episodes to scripts for shows as said before, this is definitely not a good day for HBO. HBO has only released the information said above and nothing more about the hack. They are currently investigating to see how this breach occurred and what they can do to protect themselves from being hacked again. Sort of an FU to HBO, an anonymous email was sent to the company letting them know that a few of their shows were leaked online and they were one of the first few to be able to download it. What do you think the reason of the attack was? Do you care? Also, does the information leak for shows you like to upset you, or do you simply not care and ignore it? [i][size=x-small][url=http://thehackernews.com/2017/07/game-of-thrones-leak.html]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Hackers Hijacked Chrome Extension for Web Developers With Over 1 Million Users[/color][/b] 
If you are a Google Chrome user, beware of the extensions that you install. Without informing you, major developers might be selling their work on the low to hackers that plan on using their latest purchase for malicious reasons. Those extensions that are making big bucks could come back to bite you in the rear. However, this is not always the case. Some times accounts get compromised just like this German developers account did.  The application that was hijacked in the account was the popular extension called "Copyfish". This program would allow users to download text from images. If you needed something from a PDF, this program would help do just that. It even helped download text from videos. In the past week, the extension was hacked by an anonymous hacker who then proceeded to inject malicious code into the program. Without the knowledge of over 37,000 users who use it, the program was updated and executed on a mass amount of computers. The code then emailed all the users that had the extension with a phishing link. Once the link was clicked, it brought you to a fake Google login page that required you to enter your information. What makes this hack even worse is the fact that the anonymous hacker had moved the extension to their account. Once the German developer was able to regain access to his hacked account, there was nothing he could do to fix the problem considering the program was no longer his to develop. If you have this installed, please remove it now as the problem has not been solved yet.
